snippet: Using a Web site intended to help bankers "escape from unfulfilling corporate jobs," New York magazine surveyed 74 current or recently departed finance workers. The poll, more humorous than scientific, found that while most former financiers said...
abstract: Using a Web site intended to help bankers "escape from unfulfilling corporate jobs," New York magazine surveyed 74 current or recently departed finance workers. The poll, more humorous than scientific, found that while most former financiers said they would not have stayed for "all the money in the world," they still want to keep their loft apartments.

headline.main: Why Some Entrepreneurially Minded Bankers Quit
